column1: Austintown Township was founded in 1793 in a section that used to be known as the Connecticut Western Reserve
column2: located in northeast Ohio. It was surveyed as a parcel of land 5 miles (8 km) on each side
column3: as were other townships of the Connecticut Western Reserve. Austintown was named for Warren resident and Western Reserve judge Calvin Austin.
